revised_title: First Steps in Solving the Structure of Haemoglobin by X-ray Analysis
tldr: The authors used X-ray analysis and a direct method to study the structure of a haemoglobin molecule. They conducted extensive diffraction measurements on various shrinkage stages of a haemoglobin crystal and applied a new principle to outline nodes and loops in the molecule's transform. This research provided insights into the overall dimensions and shape of the haemoglobin molecule.
